alert.note: Alert for Bennett; Jackson; Mellette; Todd; Tripp (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 10:21PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Todd, west central Tripp, Mellette, eastern Jackson and Bennett Counties through 1115 PM MDT/1215 AM CDT/... At 1020 PM MDT/1120 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Nowlin to 4 miles west of Black Pipe to 5 miles south of Lacreek Wildlife Refuge. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Norris, Black Pipe and Corn Creek around 1130 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Cedar Butte, White River, Horse Creek, Swift Bear and Spring Creek. This includes Interstate 90 in South Dakota between Mile Markers 145 and 174. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM MDT/300 AM CDT/ for west central South Dakota.
